screen_name: wishiwerebella
full_text

If this is gonna blow up, I’m just gonna drop the link to my books here because I haven’t been able to work in 6 years due to Lupus so I write from bed.  

https://t.co/DPE97GUxIp

So many people in my Lupus support groups have not been able to get their prescriptions refilled this month because the government took every pill. So many terrified Lupus patients facing great pain and organ failure because of this. And they’re holding the pills, not using them! https://t.co/cH2Fz0Veag

Also, plaquenil is safe for most, but can have very serious side effects, including blindness. Which is why I had to stop taking it even though it was my favorite Lupus med I ever tried. My eyesight was irreparably damaged. 
I hope someone is looking out for these patients.

This is utter BULLSHIT! In all my Lupus support groups we’ve asked each other and have had several people on Plaquenil tell us they have gotten Covid and not to trust it helps. Just because you aren’t “aware” they exist doesn’t mean they don’t! That’s dangerous non-science! 
🤬 https://t.co/xrW1sj8x3Z

@Tracy_N25 Messing with my lupus meds again. I may have to miss a dose if they don’t preauthoroze a med they already preauthorized in a different form. It’s the exact same med just a different needle. And pharmacy says they cancelled the old order so I can’t get one of those to not miss.
@golddustmars Doing better! They’re weaning me off the oxygen and my fever finally broke. It will probably be a couple days more but I will go home #soon 😁

Day 59: after 5 hours of phone tag and a small hissy fit I got the urgent care to give me my test results. Negative for Covid. Yay! 
Except now... wtf is wrong with me because I haven’t been this sick in years! And a negative test doesn’t make my 6+ days of fever just vanish. https://t.co/O6TBPOs3vy

@strangelandMars Ok. They’ve got me on oxygen and I can’t get out of bed but the pain has been getting better and my appetite is coming back. I’m tired all the time. I’m just impatient for this to be better and done with.

Day 44: I was reminded today how incredible my son and husband are when the unstoppable migraine pain left me in tears. I hate telling my kid no I can’t play because of pain. And then the internet went out. Misery loves company I guess. Thank god we have a large dvd collection! https://t.co/QX1axqtORD

So many people in my Lupus support groups have not been able to get their prescriptions refilled this month because the government took every pill. @tashpalo Absolutely! Those with true pain had to seek relief elsewhere. Where did they think we were gonna go?!

@strangelandMars Ok. They’ve got me on oxygen and I can’t get out of bed but the pain has been getting better and my appetite is coming back. I’m tired all the time. I’m just impatient for this to be better and done with.

Day 62: a new view. I’ve been admitted to the hospital with pneumonia. I tested positive for Covid-19. Can’t say I’m surprised given how sick I’ve been the last week. Hopefully this will only last a few days. Wash your hands and stay home folks! https://t.co/OvyrSyYwCQ

Day 62: a new view. I’ve been admitted to the hospital with pneumonia. I tested positive for Covid-19. Can’t say I’m surprised given how sick I’ve been the last week. Hopefully this will only last a few days. Wash your hands and stay home folks! https://t.co/OvyrSyYwCQ

Day 51: apparently I’m a masochist because at the 1st sign my migraine was gone I went out again for a last grocery shopping trip for awhile and to see the house. I’m all stocked up on the essentials for a long time. Plan is to go into Summer hibernation. It’s too hot out there. https://t.co/l0n8SX3Sd3

Day 44: I was reminded today how incredible my son and husband are when the unstoppable migraine pain left me in tears. I hate telling my kid no I can’t play because of pain. And then the internet went out. Misery loves company I guess. Thank god we have a large dvd collection! https://t.co/QX1axqtORD

Day 38: As you can see, my kid just loves having his picture taken. 🙃 Today was a fun family day and despite a migraine I couldn’t be happier. Lessening my social media time is definitely good for the soul. https://t.co/1P6Aq9c0Bz

Day 23: The migraine from hell has kept me down pretty much all day. At one point I got up and couldn’t find my favorite socks. My son helped me look all over the house for 10 min before asking, “Mom, did you check the sock drawer?” Spoiler alert: they were in the sock drawer. 🤦🏻‍♀️ https://t.co/P30DJwyCjz

Day 50: today was a day of bed rest and misery. Migraines are the devil. But I got a small bit of happiness because this book I ordered arrived today. I had a copy as a kid and it was my favorite book. So I bought this off eBay to read to my kid. When I can sit up again. https://t.co/84uKWgUzhQ
Day 43: Headache day. Tried to be productive. Failed miserably as a human being. Gave up. Wednesday will be better, right? https://t.co/TJd1G6sUi3

@Alex_Moore_1019 @SusanHe68546035 @lanajwright3 Okay then let’s do a one to one comparison. 50 million people died of Spanish flu, but 500 million recovered so everything is fine. It’s disrespectful to those who have lost their lives. It’s doubly disrespectful to ignore them when “we saw this coming” and still they died.

@rhysandscourt @Tatt00InReverse There’s a good chance right now your doctor will give you a tele appointment and if you say your throat feels like razor blades and has white spots they’ll send the antibiotics and move on. I’ve had televisits like that b4 and now especially they’re gonna wanna do it that way.
@tashpalo End of February my sister had the “cold from hell” and then her cat got a cough that wouldn’t go away and she had to take him to the vet and I can’t help but wonder...
Can we bring this cough syrup back? Seems like a good time. https://t.co/Z8cmftMhF0

@rokwon Ooh! Me, me, me! And uh... good moments and bad moments. When I put the phone down and go do stuff like inventory the cupboards and clean and wipe down touch surfaces with disinfectant and cook I’m good. When I sit on my phone and obsess over info, not so good. 🤷🏻‍♀️
@BG_Rising How coincidental my sister had to take her cat to the vet in state college today. He has a cold too. Poor kitties.
@JaredLeto We have very different taste in music but September by @EarthWindFire is 👍🏻

This is huge! Right now the hospital has to wait five days to know for sure they have a Covid-19 patient. Because of that, there is potential to be using tons of PPE on people who are negative. This will save a lot of resources! https://t.co/AoPuNxrzjt
I have been on hydroxychloroquine before and oooh boy the side effects! Seriously, don’t do this to yourself without a doctor’s advice. Be smart about this! https://t.co/W1c4wvxSB3

@AmandaJClements It is SO hard to try to shake off what other people say and think about us because they don’t see what’s going on inside. If you’re fighting to be strong, they say you’re faking being sick. If you’re miserably sick, they say you aren’t trying hard enough to be strong. Can’t win.

@marveIeto Tamiflu is a drug they push here to help with the flu. It’s a known side effect that it makes most children vomit. Their systems just can’t handle it. I didn’t research before, I trusted the dr and my mom and they were wrong. Never again. I research everything now.
